ğŸŸ¦  The popiah skin is way too dry, and comes across like not too fresh, is brittle and not elastic. The filling is kind of tasty though.

ğŸŸ¦ For good quality popiah rolls, the popiah skin should be soft, moist and chewy. âœ³ï¸ Here at Ann Chin Toa Payoh, the skin is dry and hard.  âœ”ï¸ They need to do something about the popiah skin.

ğŸ”´ Maybe they didn't cover the pile of popiah skins with a damp towel?  ğŸŸ§ Maybe they should keep the stack of popiah skins in a steaming basket like what most hotel eateries does.

ğŸ”·ï¸ My late Peranakan mum used to hold popiah parties and the popiah skins were placed in a traditional steaming basket to keep them soft and moist all the time. That's the way.

ğŸŸ¢ I can't say this is a good quality popiah roll. It is average at best.

Very shocking the popiah brand as annchin here is totally different taste from china town annchin  popiah . Although the working girl foreigners have some attitude problem. It jus so near my house yet I can't eat it often but have to travel to Chinatown market to have it . The fillings there are more appropriate and tasty.
Popiah was way too sweet. Almost inedible. Not the same standard as flagship store.
